info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 3:12PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Lake, north central Missoula, south central Flathead and northwestern Powell Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 312 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles east of Ronan, or 24 miles southeast of Polson, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Condon and Salmon Prairie. This includes Highway 83 between mile markers 36 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for west central Montana.
